meta.content: Falls City - FCPS Food Service and COVID-19

Food Safety and Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19)
Coronaviruses are generally thought to be spread from person-to-persons through respiratory droplets. Currently there is no evidence to support transmission of COVID-19 associated with food. Before preparing or eating food, it is important to always wash your hands with soap and water for 20 seconds for general food safety. Throughout the day, wash your hands after blowing your...

div.div: Your session will expire in 0 minutes.

div.p: Coronaviruses are generally thought to be spread from person-to-persons through respiratory droplets. Currently there is no evidence to support transmission of COVID-19 associated with food. Before preparing or eating food, it is important to always wash your hands with soap and water for 20 seconds for general food safety. Throughout the day, wash your hands after blowing your nose, coughing or sneezing, or going to the bathroom. Falls City food services is taking extra precautions during this time as they prepare grab and go meals for our community.

div.a: This institution is an equal opportunity provider.
